actionUnits.condition: Attempt to manually invoke Interactable UnityEvent(s) configured via MonoBehaviour.m_Calls on --INTERACTABLE-- or its children when specific conditions are met. In the provided scene excerpt for fileID 1782057475, there is no MonoBehaviour component (no m_Calls), Collider, or EventTrigger shown; Has_Rigidbody is False, so Grab/Transform are not applicable. To proceed, please provide the MonoBehaviour component(s) (script fileID, GUID, public no-arg methods) and any EventTrigger/Collider present on this object or its children so we can specify exact triggerring_events.

Simulate XR Interactable Activated to cover configured UnityEvent calls. The PrefabInstance 'Launcher_DartGun' (fileID: 763022183) is a child of --INTERACTABLE-- and Has_Rigidbody = True, enabling Trigger per rules. This manual trigger replicates the XR 'Activate' to ensure events fire without controller input.

Simulate XR Interactable Activated to cover configured UnityEvent calls on Launcher_DartGun. Scene MonoBehaviour_1 (id: 763022187, XR Interaction Toolkit, guid: 0ad34abafad169848a38072baa96cdb2) has m_Activated.m_PersistentCalls.m_Calls bound to LaunchProjectile.Fire (MonoBehaviour_0 id: 763022186, guid: 623c5848030e9674893bb3bb376834b8) and PlayQuickSound.Play (MonoBehaviour_2 id: 763022189, guid: 0755a2ba17a31d643b4a27e3034d8a79). Attempt to exceed velocity thresholds to invoke Candle OnVelocity.OnBegin UnityEvent. Scene MonoBehaviour_1 on Candle (id: 1713785677, guid: 2eb756a4b82b24040a468c0a73063e4d) has beginThreshold 1.25 and OnBegin.m_PersistentCalls calling ParticleSystem.Stop on fileID 2038875. Note: this component is disabled (m_Enabled: 0); if not enabled at runtime, the event will not fire. If enabled, moving the Candle quickly should trigger OnBegin and stop the flame particles.

Manually exercise audio control methods on PlaySoundsFromList to cover playback paths. Scene MonoBehaviour_0 (id: 1734837741, guid: 76a895b5e674db04d8b4f8110c068852) is PlaySoundsFromList with shouldLoop enabled and a populated audioClips list. XRGrabInteractable (MonoBehaviour_0 id: 1768355684, guid: 8a35f6cfbfba9b548aaa00d52cfe8a50) is attached on Light_Switch. Its UnityEvents (m_Calls) are configured in scene meta: SelectEntered invokes ToggleOnOff.Toggle on two components (fileID: 1887208566 and 2061883187) and also SetActive(false) on a target GameObject (fileID: 377328966). HoverEntered/Exited invoke SetActive(true/false) on that same GameObject. Per Trigger action constraints, only public no-arg methods on MonoBehaviours can be invoked directly; thus we manually invoke both Toggle() calls to cover SelectEntered’s script paths.

XRGrabInteractable (id: 1768355684) HoverEntered/Exited UnityEvents call GameObject.SetActive(true/false) on fileID 377328966. These require a bool parameter and target a GameObject, which cannot be invoked via the Trigger action (only supports no-arg MonoBehaviour methods). Provide a no-arg wrapper MonoBehaviour on that GameObject (e.g., IndicatorProxy.Enable()/Disable()) or confirm an alternative callable no-arg method so we can include them; otherwise these two event calls can only be validated through actual XR hover.

GameObject lacks Rigidbody; Collider/EventTrigger not specified. The only listed MonoBehaviour on Fireplace_Traditional is fileID 631718164 (guid 474bcb49853aa07438625e644c072ee6), which does not match the provided TeleportAnchorWithFade script and exposes no known public no-arg methods. TeleportAnchorWithFade overrides XR interaction callbacks (OnSelectEntered/Exited/Activated/Deactivated), which are protected and parameterized, so they cannot be invoked by a Trigger action. To cover the fade/teleport sequence, we need confirmation of a Collider on the object, the presence and scene fileID of a TeleportAnchorWithFade (or TeleportationAnchor) component attached to Fireplace_Traditional, the teleportTrigger setting, and any UnityEvent m_Calls wired on this object.
